entry.title: People
entry.content:
Waking up terrified -
but of what?

Is it fear that the future will be bleak,
because it will.
Is it fear of the past,
because the trauma resurfaces.
Is it fear of the present -
but how is fear of the present possible?
I realise it cannot be fear of the present.

Remember,
as a child,
holding tight to the bar across your legs,
while you rode the rollercoaster?
The excitement of what is ahead -
and the trepidation.
It is like that,
but without the excitement.

Can it be just fear of what the future will bring -
or is it,
perhaps,
the anxiety of not wanting to deal with people.
People are so tedious,
so capricious,
so self-centred.

If you woke up tomorrow and you were the last person on Earth,
would you still have this anxiety?

I think not.

author.name: Gerald Tūruapō Jordan, MBA, MEd, MCouns

entry.title: Beginnings
entry.content:
Where do you begin to challenge injustice that circles the globe -
where do you begin to advocate for peace,
when the tables of almost everyone,
when the bowels of almost everyone,
are full of suffering,
are full of violence,
are full of indifference?

It feels like a daunting task,
but it is one that must be begun,
for if we never begin,
we will never arrive at a better world.

A world of empathy, kindness and compassion.
A world where all are recognised for their intrinsic value.

Ahimsā!

entry.title: Creative Writing Aotearoa
entry.content:
For some time, I have considered taking a creative writing course, but I haven't found any that I think would be terribly helpful. Don't get me wrong, I have a lot to learn! The issues with the courses I have found include things like a strange 20th Century expectation that I would want to sit in the same room with others, when I was actually just WRITING. If you can't write from a distance, you can do almost nothing from a distance. Other issues? Finding courses with writers teaching who seemed to know what they were doing, finding courses that would emphasise what I wanted to emphasise, etc.

So, I have created this site to focus in writing and writers in Aotearoa New Zealand!

I will discuss the name choice and other things, soon!

Ka pai!

Tūruapō, MBA, MEd, MCouns

entry.title: Kaitoa
entry.content:
The word "kaitoa" in te reo Māori has multiple meanings, including "it serves you right!", "warrior" and as the name of an evil deity. I liked the possible multiple interpretations as applied to this site.

Source: https://maoridictionary.co.nz/word/2025
